api_sensor module¶

class api_sensor.Measure(file)[source]¶

Bases: object

Measure class. We use this as a public class example class. It has the necessary methods to process the previously created file

* Note: You never call this class before create a file object.*

getCharacteristics()[source]¶

Method to get the characteristics processed. :return: Gas1, Gas2 :rtype: list, list

getCyclesData()[source]¶
getGases()[source]¶

Method to get the gases name

Returns

gas1_name, gas2_name

Return type

str, str

getGasesCycles()[source]¶

Method to get the gas cycle variables

Returns

number_of_cycles_gas1, number_of_cycles_gas2, gas1_index, gas2_index

Return type

int, int, list, list

Method to get the humidity variable of measure

Returns

humidity(%)

Return type

list

Method to get the gas cycle index

Returns

gas1_index, gas2_index

Return type

list, list

Returns

number_of_cycles_gas1, number_of_cycles_gas2

sample_time_mean

getSamplesCycles(gasId)[source]¶
Parameters

gasId – Id to return data.

If gasId=1 return gas1 data.

If gasId=2 return gas2 data.

If gasId=3 return gas1 and gas2 data.

[s1,s2,s3,s4]

getTsSteps()[source]¶

Method to return t_s list[cycle1, cycle2,…,cyclen] :return: t_s_steps :rtype: list[cycle_i, …, cycle_n]

getVoltage()[source]¶

Return voltage value of heaters in every cycle of gas :return: v1,v2,v3,v4

getVoltageHeaters()[source]¶

Method to get the voltage variable of measure

Returns

voltage(mV)

Return type

list

readCharacteristics()[source]¶

Method to read Characteristics of the Measure, such us, response, adsorption and desorption time (not yet implemented), temperatures, slopes etc.

readCyclesData(Gas, Index)[source]¶

Method to read data of every Cycle getting variables list with a number of elements equal to number of cycle gas

readGasesCycles()[source]¶

Method to read the different gas cyles in order to obtain the index where concentration changes.

readResponse(gasId)[source]¶

Method to read response in every cycle.

Parameters

gasId – It is of the gas to be read with the method <<self.getSamplesCycles(gasId)>>

readSampleTime()[source]¶

Method to read the sample time in the measure.

readSamplesCycles()[source]¶

Method to read data in every cycle generating an output list where

  1. Element 0 are sensor values gas 1.

  2. Element 1 are gas 1 values.

  3. Element 2 are sensor values gas 2.

  4. Element 3 are gas 2 values.

readSlopes(gasName, gasId)[source]¶

Method to read the 3 slopes within gas cycle.

Parameters

  • gasName – It’s the name of the gas to be read

  • gasId – It is of the gas to be read with the method <<self.getSamplesCycles(gasId)>>

api_sensor.calculateSlope(r2, r1, t2, t1)[source]¶

Method to calculate slope of a specific step.

Parameters

  • r2 – final resistance

  • r1 – initial resistances

  • t2 – final time

  • t1 – initial time

Returns

slope. (r2-r1)/(t2-t1)

Return type

float

api_sensor.getStatistics(variable, name, output)[source]¶

Method to apply different statistics formulas, such as, mean, var etc. Depend on the output variable return one or other.

api_sensor.plotSlope(Time, Sensor, Gas, Time_Final, Time_Initial, Sample_Time, Slope, N, Path, Title, Id)[source]¶

Method to plot the slopes calculated.

Parameters

  • Time – time variable

  • Sensor – sensor data

  • Gas – gas data

  • Time_Final – Final time data

  • Time_Initial – Initial Time data

  • Sample_Time – Sample time Mean calculated

  • Slope – Slope calculated

  • N – n value of line (y=slope*x+N)

  • Path – Path to be stored

  • Title – Title to be stored

  • Id – Gas id

api_sensor.procesarPendientes(sensor, index, t1_1, t2_1, t1_2, t2_2, t1_3, t2_3, tramo1_inf_R, tramo1_sup_R, tramo2_inf_R, tramo2_sup_R, tramo3_inf_R, tramo3_sup_R)[source]¶

Method to calculate the three slopes in a specific cycle.

Parameters

  • sensor – Sensor data

  • index – Index of data in a specific cycle

  • t1_1 – time1_1. Time 1 step 1

  • t2_1 – time2_1. Time 2 step 2

  • t1_2 – time1_2. Time 1 step 2

  • t2_2 – time2_2. Time 2 step 2

  • t1_3 – time1_3. Time 1 step 3

  • t2_3 – time2_3. Time 2 step 3

  • tramo1_inf_R – Value of resistance inf in step 1

  • tramo1_sup_R – Value of resistance sup in step 1

  • tramo2_inf_R – Value of resistance inf in step 2

  • tramo2_sup_R – Value of resistance sup in step 2

  • tramo3_inf_R – Value of resistance inf in step 3

  • tramo3_sup_R – Value of resistance sup in step 3

Returns

m, n

Return type

list, list
